data.event: It was founded in 1873 and was named after John H. Mitchell, a politician.
At the request of William "Brawdie" Johnson, a blacksmith, a post office was established at Mitchell in 1873.
Senator Mitchell held the office in 1873−79, 1885−97, and 1901−05.
Senator Mitchell held the office in 1873−79, 1885−97, and 1901−05.
Platted in 1885, the community was incorporated in 1893.
Platted in 1885, the community was incorporated in 1893.

event.title: 1872 the first school in Wheeler County was established

data.event: In 1872 the first school in Wheeler County was established near Mitchell, and in 1874 it was relocated to the town itself.
In 1872 the first school in Wheeler County was established near Mitchell, and in 1874 it was relocated to the town itself.

event.title: the next two decades, Mitchell grew

data.event: Over the next two decades, Mitchell grew to include a store, assay office, two churches, two hotels, livery stable, three houses of ill-repute (one of which is still standing), five saloons, a flour mill, a livery stable, and an apothecary.
About half the town was destroyed by fire in 1899, but it was later rebuilt.
